  • MPU

MPU¶

The ARCv2-based Memory Protection Unit (MPU) provides memory protection by dividing the address space into regions associated with specific attributes such as Read, Write, and Execute. If an attempt is made to access a region for which an associated attribute is not permitted, the ARCv2-based processors raise a Protection Violation exception, and this exception prevents the faulting instruction from completing.

Functions

uint8_t arc_mpu_regions(void)¶
void arc_mpu_enable(void)¶

Enable the memory protection unit.

void arc_mpu_disable(void)¶

Disable the memory protection unit.

void arc_mpu_region_config(uint32_t index, uint32_t base, uint32_t size, uint32_t region_attr)¶

Configure the given mpu region.

Parameters

  • index: Region index to be configured

  • base: Base address for the region

  • size: Region size of the region to be configured

  • region_attr: Attribute value of mpu region

void arc_mpu_default(uint32_t region_attr)¶

Set default attribute of mpu region.

Parameters

  • region_attr: Attribute value

int32_t arc_mpu_in_region(uint32_t index, uint32_t start, uint32_t size)¶

Check whether [start, start+size] in the given mpu region.

Return

1 in the given mpu region, 0 not in

Parameters

  • index: Region index

  • start: Start address of memory

  • size: Size of memory

int32_t arc_mpu_probe(uint32_t addr)¶

Probe whether the given address in mpu entries.

Return

-1 not in mpu entries, -2 mpu version error, >= 0 mpu entry number

Parameters

  • addr: The given address
